head.supplied: Botanic Gardens ¶ 26 August 1868 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to solicit that you will be pleased to grant permission that the various improvements and additional works carried out in this establishmen...

div.p: Q68/11799, unit 750, VPRS 44/P inward registered and unregistered correspondence, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.
MS written by Ernst Heyne and signed by M. Botanic Gardens

I have the honor to solicit that you will be pleased to grant permission that the various improvements and additional works carried out in this establishment since the issue of my last Report, as shown on a Sketch-Plan drawn in this Office may be added to the lithographed plan previously published, a copy of which is appended, as it appears that the stone containing the lithographic drawing of the latter has been preserved so that the additions can be made at a trifling expense, which will, including that for printing 1000 copies not exceed thirteen pounds Sterlg., such expenditure to be charged to the Vote for publishing Works. It was found that the photolithographic process was not well applicable for the above work.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
The honorable the President of the Board of Land & Works
Grant minuted his approval for M's request on 27 August 1868 and it was duly sent to the Government Printer.
